intro: Hedeoma floribunda, commonly known as the Florida hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually purple or pink, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Hedeoma floribunda is often found in swampy habitats and is adapted to tolerate periodic flooding.
